summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York residence and private island. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation. Electronic devices were seized from his person and his residences. The warrant seeks evidence of his alleged crimes and his co-conspirators.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The search aims to find evidence of communications with her and her involvement.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly names Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications and activities between them related to the alleged offenses.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI. Two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person during this arrest.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's New York City residence at 9 East 71st Street, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James in the U.S. Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices from various structures on the island.

events.title: Warrant Issued for Device Search
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued this search warrant, authorizing forensic analysis of the 62 seized devices for evidence spanning 1994 to 2019.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
St. Thomas Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were subject to the search warrant: 2 from Epstein's person at arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her.
The search seeks evidence for violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. 1591), transportation of minors (2422), enticement to travel (2423), and conspiracy (371).
The warrant authorizes a search for a wide range of evidence, including communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs of victims or potential victims.
The document indicates the FBI used an internal barcode system (e.g., E6515034) to inventory and track the vast number of seized devices.
